objectives: To review fundamental concepts of mechanics from a more advanced perspective
To develop a strong understanding of dynamics, gravitation and oscillatory motion
To introduce the foundations of Special Theory of Relativity and its physical consequences

units.title: Fundamentals of Dynamics
topics: Momentum of variable-mass system: motion of rocket
Motion of a projectile in uniform gravitational field
Dynamics of a system of particles
Force as a gradient of potential energy
Law of conservation of mechanical energy
Elastic and inelastic collisions in one and two dimensions
Collisions in centre of mass and laboratory frames

units.title: Rotational Dynamics
topics: Angular momentum of a particle and system of particles
Principle of conservation of angular momentum
Calculation of moment of inertia for rectangular, cylindrical and spherical bodies
Poisson’s ratio and its limiting values
Twisting torque on a cylinder or wire

units.title: Gravitation and Central Force Motion
topics: Potential and field due to spherical shell and solid sphere
Deduction of Newton’s law of gravitation from Kepler’s law
Basic idea of global positioning system (GPS)

units.title: Oscillations and Non-Inertial Systems
topics: Differential equation of SHM and its solution
Kinetic energy, potential energy and total energy in SHM
Laws of physics in rotating coordinate systems

units.title: Relativity
topics: Postulates of Special Theory of Relativity
Time dilation and its experimental verification

learning_outcomes: Apply laws of dynamics to systems of particles and rotational motion
Analyse gravitational motion and central force problems
Understand oscillatory motion and non-inertial reference frames
Explain the basic principles and consequences of Special Theory of Relativity

textbooks.title: An Introduction to Mechanics
textbooks.author: Daniel Kleppner and Robert J. Kolenkow

additional_reading.title: The Feynman Lectures on Physics, Vol. I
additional_reading.author: R. P. Feynman, R. B. Leighton, M. Sands

additional_reading.title: Analytical Mechanics
additional_reading.author: G. R. Fowles and G. L. Cassiday
